title: Simplify site theme to a consistent 1–2 premium brand colors

requirements.summary: Consolidate global theme tokens and utilities so the site uses only 1–2 brand accent colors (plus neutrals) across light/dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: Across all pages/components, accent styling is limited to a maximum of two brand colors (plus neutrals like background/foreground/muted/border).
No UI elements (text, borders, rings, icons, buttons, badges, gradients) rely on the rotating accent palette or subject/route-based accent variety.
Light and dark mode remain readable with sufficient contrast, and no broken styles/classes appear.

file_operations.description: Update global CSS variables and custom utilities to remove multi-accent tokens and multi-stop gradients; redefine accent-related variables/section background gradients to use only the chosen 1–2 premium brand colors while preserving readable light/dark contrast.

Reduce the Tailwind safelist and extended accent color/shadow entries so only the 1–2 chosen brand accent utilities remain (text/bg/border/ring/hover/data-state variants as needed); ensure no unused multi-accent utilities remain referenced by the app.

requirements.summary: Refactor the accent utility layer to expose a small fixed set of brand accents (max two) and update callers to stop using route/subject/index-based multi-color rotation.
acceptanceCriteria: Utilities in frontend/src/utils/accents.ts do not produce more than two accent variants.
Pages/components that currently call getAccentByIndex/getRouteAccent/getSubjectAccent (or similar) are updated to use the new fixed brand accent(s).
No Tailwind class generation relies on dynamic/interpolated accent names (i.e., avoid patterns that Tailwind cannot statically detect).

file_operations.description: Replace the rotating multi-accent palette and route/subject maps with a fixed brand accent API (max two accents). Ensure all returned Tailwind class strings remain literal (no computed class-name interpolation) and keep helpers aligned with the reduced accent set.

Update feature/benefit/CTA sections to use the new fixed brand accent utilities instead of getAccentByIndex and any dynamic Tailwind class construction (e.g., remove `hover:${...}` and `hover:border-${...}` patterns) so Tailwind can statically detect all classes.
Replace hardcoded teal/pink/violet accent usage with the new fixed brand accent(s) from the refactored accents utility so social icons, headings, and highlights no longer mix multiple accents.

Update navigation and auth/profile accent styling to use the new fixed brand accent(s); remove route-based accent variability by switching to the refactored accents utilities and ensuring all Tailwind classes are statically defined.
Remove subject-based accent variation by switching from getSubjectAccent to the fixed brand accent(s) and update headings/loading states/cards/badges to use only the brand accents.
Remove subject-based accent variation by switching from getSubjectAccent to the fixed brand accent(s) and update headings/loading states/cards/accordion triggers to use only the brand accents.

Remove subject-based accent variation by switching from getSubjectAccent/tab trigger accent rotation to the fixed brand accent(s); ensure TabsTrigger classes and all other accent-related classes remain statically enumerable.

Update metric cards and chart color helpers usage so charts/metrics no longer rotate through many accents; ensure chart colors derive only from the fixed brand accents and remain readable in light/dark mode.

Replace any non-brand accent usage (e.g., green/violet/teal/etc.) with the fixed brand accent(s) for icons, highlights, and buttons, keeping success messaging readable without introducing new accent colors.
Replace any non-brand accent usage (e.g., red/orange/violet mixes) with the fixed brand accent(s) for icons, highlights, and buttons, maintaining error clarity while adhering to the 1–2 accent limit.
Update profile UI accent styles (rings, buttons, highlights, progress indicators if present) to rely only on the fixed brand accent(s) and remove any lingering multi-accent utility usage.

requirements.summary: Update key UI surfaces (Header, Footer, Home hero/CTA/sections) to a consistent premium 1–2 color theme and remove multi-accent gradient text/decoration.
acceptanceCriteria: Header branding (logo ring, title text, nav active/hover styles, auth buttons) uses only the chosen 1–2 brand colors for accents.
Footer social icons, headings, and highlights use only the chosen 1–2 brand colors for accents (no teal/pink/violet mix).
Home page hero/title/CTA and section background gradient utilities use only the chosen 1–2 brand colors for accent/decoration (no multi-accent gradients).

file_operations.description: Remove multi-accent gradient logo text and mixed accent rings/buttons; re-style logo ring, brand title, nav active indicator, hover states, and auth/profile UI so accents use only the fixed 1–2 brand colors.
Update footer brand block, section headings, social links, and the copyright/attribution highlight so all accents use only the fixed 1–2 brand colors; remove any teal/pink/violet mixed treatments.

Replace multi-accent gradient hero title/CTA styling and any multi-accent section decorations with brand-consistent styling; ensure feature cards, benefit list, and CTA section use only the fixed 1–2 brand colors and no dynamic Tailwind class generation.

Update custom section background gradient utility classes (e.g., section-bg-gradient-* and border-accent-gradient) to use only the 1–2 brand colors (no teal/violet/pink/amber/cyan blends) while keeping subtle decoration in both themes.
